_header: I-wandering full weary and walking the ways
_description: An ABC alliterative poem on flowers, one stanza to each letter of the alphabet — 15 alliterative quatrains (abab)

OxfLinLat129.First Lines:
Y Wandryng ful wery & walkynge þe wayesIn Somer whan
                    þe schene sonne saylyd on hyȝe…
OxfLinLat129.Last Lines:
…And for þy blode þat bleddyst to thy blys vs
                    bryngeAnd send vs here soþely þy swete helpe at nede
                    Amen
OxfLinLat129.Attributed Title:
Vmbraculi descriptio ab herbis & arboribus illud constituentibus
                        secundum literam seriem cum benedictione insidentium (f. 44, top margin,
                    by a later hand)
OxfLinLat129.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “An Unpublished Alliterative Poem on Plant-Names from Lincoln College,
                Oxford, MS. Lat. 129 (E).” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 26 [224] (1979): 504-8: 504-8.
